qas.question: What record label did May and Taylor leave in 2010?
What label did Queen join in August 2010?
What program interviewed Queen on 22 September 2010?
Island records is a subsidiary of what group?

context: On 7 May 2010, May and Taylor announced that they were quitting their record label, <a0_0>EMI<a0_0/>, after almost 40 years. On 20 August 2010, Queen's manager Jim Beach put out a Newsletter stating that the band had signed a new contract with <a1_0>Universal Music<a1_0/>. During an interview for <a2_0>Hardtalk<a2_0/> on the BBC on 22 September, May confirmed that the band's new deal was with Island Records, a subsidiary of <a3_0>Universal Music Group<a3_0/>. For the first time since the late 1980s, Queen's catalogue will have the same distributor worldwide, as their current North American label—Hollywood Records—is currently distributed by Universal (for a time in the late 1980s, Queen was on EMI-owned Capitol Records in the US).
